org.globus.opensaml11.saml
Class SAMLSubjectAssertion

java.lang.Object
  org.globus.opensaml11.saml.ObjectEquiv
      org.globus.opensaml11.saml.SAMLObject
          org.globus.opensaml11.saml.SAMLSignedObject
              org.globus.opensaml11.saml.SAMLAssertion
                  org.globus.opensaml11.saml.SAMLSubjectAssertion
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class SAMLSubjectAssertion
extends SAMLAssertion
implements Cloneable

Represents a SAML Assertion that conforms to the SAML V1.1 Subject-based Assertion Profile.

A SAMLSubjectAssertion may or may not contain an empty SubjectStatement. In any case, a SAMLSubjectAssertion does not contain a redundant SubjectStatement. This characteristic is invariant throughout the lifetime of the assertion.

Author:
Tom Scavo

Builds an assertion out of its component parts

Parameters:
issuer - Name of SAML authority issuing assertion
notBefore - Optional start of validity
notOnOrAfter - Optional end of validity
conditions - Set of conditions on validity
advice - Optional advice content
statements - Set of SAML statements to place in assertion

SAMLException - Raised if an assertion cannot be constructed from the supplied information

getSubject

public SAMLSubject getSubject()
Gets the statement subject. All statements contained in this SAMLSubjectAssertion have subjects that "very strongly match" this subject, by definition.

Returns:
The statement subject

addStatement

public void addStatement(SAMLStatement s)
                  throws SAMLException
Adds a statement to this SAMLSubjectAssertion. If the statement is a SubjectStatement, and the assertion already contains a statement (of any type), this method does nothing. If the statement is something other than a SubjectStatement, this method removes any SubjectStatement before adding the statement.

Overrides:
addStatement in class SAMLAssertion
Parameters:
s - The statement to add
Throws:
SAMLException - Raised if an error occurs while adding the statement

addSubjectStatement

public void addSubjectStatement(SAMLSubject subject)
                         throws SAMLException
Adds a SubjectStatement to this SAMLSubjectAssertion instance. If the assertion already contains a statement (of any type), this method does nothing.

Parameters:
subject - The subject of the statement to add
Throws:
SAMLException - Raised if an error occurs while adding the statement

removeSubjectStatements

public void removeSubjectStatements()
Removes all SubjectStatements from this SAMLSubjectAssertion instance (if any exist).

hasRedundantSubjectStatement

protected boolean hasRedundantSubjectStatement()
Determines if this SAMLSubjectAssertion instance contains a redundant SubjectStatement. A SubjectStatement is redundant if this SAMLSubjectAssertion contains more than one statement (of any type).

Returns:
true if and only if this SAMLSubjectAssertion instance contains a redundant SubjectStatement

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Determines if this SAMLSubjectAssertion is empty, that is, if it either contains no statements or only a single SubjectStatement. Thus, an empty assertion contains a SAML Subject but no content.

Returns:
true if and only if this SAMLSubjectAssertion is empty

checkValidity

public void checkValidity()
                   throws SAMLException
Since a SAMLSubjectAssertion is an extension of SAMLAssertion, it must already have both an issuer and at least one statement.

Overrides:
checkValidity in class SAMLAssertion
Throws:
SAMLException - Raised if the serialized object would be invalid SAML, excluding any embedded objects
See Also:
SAMLAssertion.checkValidity()

veryStronglyMatches

public static boolean veryStronglyMatches(SAMLSubject s1,
                                          SAMLSubject s2)
Two subjects very strongly match if each strongly matches the other.

Returns:
True if and only if the two subjects very strongly match
